<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_deinit:
```c
static int lfs_deinit(lfs_t *lfs) {
    // free allocated memory
    if (!lfs->cfg->read_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->rcache.buffer);
    }

    if (!lfs->cfg->prog_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->pcache.buffer);
    }

    if (!lfs->cfg->lookahead_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->lookahead.buffer);
    }

    return 0;
}
```
</target_code>

    // zero to avoid information leak
    memset(pcache->buffer, 0xff, lfs->cfg->cache_size);
    pcache->block = LFS_BLOCK_NULL;

<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
struct lfs_lookahead {
        lfs_block_t start;
        lfs_block_t size;
        lfs_block_t next;
        lfs_block_t ckpoint;
        uint8_t *buffer;
    } lookahead;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The lookahead.buffer member is declared as uint8_t * (mutable). If the buffer can alias a user-supplied, read-only buffer (e.g. lfs->cfg->lookahead_buffer), it should be declared const uint8_t * to avoid discarding const qualification. In lfs_deinit the code only frees lookahead.buffer when cfg->lookahead_buffer is NULL, which suggests lookahead.buffer may point to cfg->lookahead_buffer when that is provided — in that case the non-const pointer is inappropriate and violates Rule 8.13.
